data.name: AlcoholAndDrugInterviewerRating_InterviewerScoreOfAlcoholTreatmentNeed
data.value: No treatment necessary|Treatment needed to intervene in life threatening situation

data.name: AlcoholAndDrugInterviewerRating_InterviewerScoreOfAttitude
data.value: Shows appropriate concern w/insight and acceptance of an addiction problem||Is ambivalent, somewhat less concerned than circumstances warrant||Rationalizes addiction problems as mostly due to other causes||Shows no evidence of concern at all||Openly rejects evidence of apparent addiction problems|

data.name: AlcoholAndDrugInterviewerRating_InterviewerScoreOfDrugTreatmentNeed
data.value: No treatment necessary|Treatment needed to intervene in life threatening situation

data.name: AlcoholAndDrugInterviewerRating_InterviewerScoreOfReadiness
data.value: Has completed treatment and fully engaged in periodic maintenance efforts|Is actively participating in, or completing treatment with maintenance plans|Is spontaneously seeking treatment||Is open to treatment with prompting||Is ambivalent or unclear of plans||Wants to drop treatment|Refuses any treatment

data.name: CinaScale_ExperiencedNauseaOrVomitedRecently
data.value: no nausea and no vomiting|Mild nausea with no vomiting|Constant dry heaves but no vomiting|||Constant nausea, frequent dry heaves and vomiting|| ||

data.name: EmploymentAndSupportSection_InterviewerRatingPatientNeedForEmploymentCounseling
data.value: No treatment necessary|Treatment needed to intervene in life threatening situation

data.name: FamilyAndSocialHistorySection_InterviewerRatingPatientNeedForFamilySocialCounseling
data.value: No treatment necessary|Treatment needed to intervene in life threatening situation

data.name: InterviewerRating_AppearanceofAgitation
data.value: Not at All|Slightly symptomatic (patient reports symptoms, no impairment of behavior or function)||Moderately (observable symptoms, no impairment)||Considerably (overt or persistent symptoms suggesting risk of impairment)||Extremely (persistent symptoms with evidence of or report of impairment)|

data.name: InterviewerRating_LevelOfSupervisionNeededForProtectionFromSelfHarm
data.value: None at All| A little (1-2 visits/week)||Some (<=9 hours/week)||Much (approximately 6 hours/day)||Extreme (24 hours/day)|

data.name: InterviewerRating_LikelihoodOfRecurrenceOfPsychiatricDecompensation
data.value: Not at All|Slightly (positive history but not under current conditions)||Moderately (positive history and current conditions are simlar to past, but patient has better support system or less stress)||Considerably (history and conditions predict high risk)||Extremely (symptoms evident now)|

data.name: InterviewerRating_LimitedInAbilityToContractForSafetyIfRiskOfHarmToSelfOrOthers
data.value: Not at All|Slightly symptomatic (patient reports symptoms, no impairment of behavior or function)||Moderately (observable symptoms, no impairment)||Considerably (overt or persistent symptoms suggesting risk of impairment)||Extremely (persistent symptoms with evidence of or report of impairment)|

data.name: InterviewerRating_PatientNeedForPsychiatricPsychologicalTreatmentRating
data.value: No psychological (i.e. non-substance) problems|Minimal psychological issues (i.e. tolerable grief or depressed mood)||Moderate problems require close outpatient follow-up (e.g. suicidal thoughts)||Considerable problems and risk, especially if uses substances (e.g. history of implusive suicidality, moderate dementia)|| Severe psychological problems (e.g. acutley suicidal, manic, or psychotic)|

data.name: LegalSection_InterviewerRatingPatientNeedForLegalServiceCounseling
data.value: 0 = No treatment necessary|9 = Treatment needed to intervene on a life threatening situation

data.name: MedicalSection_InterviewerObservationOfPatientAgitationLevel
data.value: Normal Activity|Somewhat more than normal activity|Moderately fidgety and restless|||Paces back and forth during most of the interview, or constantly thrashes about||

data.name: MedicalSection_InterviewerRatingOfPatientNeedForMedicalTreatment
data.value: No medical (i.e. non-substance) problems|Minimal health issues (e.g. backache, dental disease)||Moderate problems require close outpatient follow-up (e.g. diabetes)||Considerable problems and may need nursing care during day, evening and nights (e.g. chronic pancreatitis)||Severe health problems and may require physician's change in medical plan at any time (e.g. jaundice, vomiting blood, active seizure)|
